citation.article-title: Characterization of a novel gram-positive, catalase-negative coccus from horses: description of Eremococcus coleocola gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Eremococcus (E.re.mo.coc'cus. Gr. adj. eremos lonely; Gr. n. coccus a grain, berry; M.L. n. Eremococcus, a lonely or isolated coccus, referring to its distinct phylogenetic position)
Eremococcus cells are Gram-positive cocci, some of which may be elongated, that occur singly, in pairs or in short chains.
α-Haemolytic on sheep- and horseblood agar.
Does not grow at 10°C or in 10% NaCl.
Acid but no gas is produced from glucose.
Acid is not produced from most other sugars.
Arginine dihydrolase and pyroglutamic acid arylamidase are produced.
Leucine arylamidase and alkaline phosphatase are not produced.
The G+C content of DNA of the type strain of the type species is 40 mol%.
The cell wall murein type is L-lysine-direct (A1α).
The type species of the genus is Eremococcus coleocola.
